PPMonth.title: Mad Men
PPMonth.notes: Thanks to [Corby Anderson](https://twitter.com/corbya) (Bay Area Peninsula GC) and [Matt Cleinman](https://twitter.com/MattOnABicycle/) (Pittsburgh GC) for writing all of December's puzzles! Meta-meta puzzle courtesy of [Neal Tibrewala](https://twitter.com/zyrain) (Austin GC).

puzzle.title: Planning the Pitch
puzzle.hint: Rearrange the dialog to make a coherent conversation.
Each piece of dialog has one special word.
Each piece of dialog has one letter from the NATO phonetic alphabet.
Take the NATO letters, ordered by the proper conversation, to find the solution.
The solution is LETS GET LIBERATED.

puzzle.title: Choosing the Contact
puzzle.hint: It sounds like you need to think about homophones. Think about names from that NPR show, Car Talk.
You’re looking for first and last names that suit the job titles... or at least *sound* like they do.
Car Talk’s Russian chauffeur is Pikop Andropov. (Pick up and drop off)
The numbers in parentheses say how many letters/words are in the name’s homophone.
If you’ve got names, then great! Now use the floor number.
Use the floor number as an index into the *homophone* name (e.g., into "pick up and drop off" and not into "Pikop Andropov")

puzzle.title: Picking the Colors
puzzle.hint: Figure out what letters are missing from the color names.
Notice that most of the colors names don’t belong in the wedge that they’re in. Focus on those that do.
Go wedge by wedge. The flavor text hints what to start with.
The flavor text also hints to work from inside to outside.
Token and monopoly only figure in at the end.
Once you’ve filled in the boxes with missing letters, google to find out what it’s talking about.

puzzle.title: Selecting the Slogan
puzzle.hint: You need to find the companies or products the that slogans are for. (Googling is ok)

The names, in alphabetical order:
- Alka Seltzer - Brylcreem - Canada Dry - Fisher Price - Hyatt - Listerine - Lufthansa - Max Factor - Nokia - Odeon - Pantene - Samsonite - Snapple - Tefal - Volvo
"heart, the center, the essence" should tell you what to do with each name.

puzzle.title: Signing the Talent
puzzle.hint: Each rebus is part of a famous quote, with one word missing - represented by the question mark.
Each rebus's quote is from a person on the second page.
Insert the missing word for each person into the speech bubble on the second page.
Those words are a famous Muhammad Ali quote. Like before, find the missing word.

puzzle.title: Making the Pitch (meta puzzle)
puzzle.hint: You’ve gathered all four elements for the solution… did you notice that you’ve actually gathered elements?
What do those elements go with? Carbon would go with fiber… but what do your elements go with?
The flavor text hints at an order for the elements
Draw the lines in order, and the letters that the line crosses spell your answer.

puzzle.title: Mixing the Drinks (bonus puzzle)
puzzle.hint: Aperitifs come before a meal. Digestifs come after,
When the drink menu talks about “parts” it really means “letters”
Take n letters from the front of the bolded liqueurs for aperitifs, the end for digestifs.
index into the drink names by the dollar amount for the final answer.

puzzle.title: Meta-Meta (bonus puzzle using all 2015 meta puzzle answers)
puzzle.notes: The hint for this puzzle gets you started by telling you the answers for each of the 2015 meta puzzles.
